columnSorted.description:
Event fired after the column has already been sorted and data - re-rendered.
   Function takes arguments evt and ui.
   Use ui.owner to get reference to igGridSorting.
   Use ui.owner.grid to get reference to igGrid.
   Use ui.columnKey to get column key.
   Use ui.direction to get sorting direction.

columnSorting.description:
Event fired before sorting is invoked for a certain column.
   Return false in order to cancel column sorting.
   Function takes arguments evt and ui.
   Use ui.owner to get reference to igGridSorting.
   Use ui.owner.grid to get reference to igGrid.
   Use ui.columnKey to get column key.
   Use ui.direction to get sorting direction.

modalDialogButtonApplyClick.description:
event fired when button Apply in modal dialog is clicked
   The handler function takes arguments evt and ui.
   Use ui.owner to get the reference to the igGridSorting widget.
   Use ui.owner.grid to get the reference to the igGrid widget.
   Use ui.modalDialogElement to get a reference to the modal dialog element. This is a jQuery object.
   Use ui.columnsToSort to get array of columns which should be sorted - array of objects of sort order - Asc/Desc and columnIdentifier

modalDialogMoving.description:
event fired every time the modal dialog changes its position.
   The handler function takes arguments evt and ui.
   Use ui.owner to get the reference to the igGridSorting widget.
   Use ui.owner.grid to get the reference to the igGrid widget.
   Use ui.modalDialogElement to get a reference to the modal dialog element. This is a jQuery object.
   Use ui.originalPosition to get the original position of the modal dialog div as { top, left } object, relative to the page.
   Use ui.position to get the current position of the modal dialog div as { top, left } object, relative to the page.

modalDialogSortingChanged.description:
event fired when sorting of column is changed in modal dialog. Column should be sorted
   The handler function takes arguments evt and ui.
   Use ui.owner to get the reference to the igGridSorting widget.
   Use ui.owner.grid to get the reference to the igGrid widget.
   Use ui.modalDialogElement to get a reference to the modal dialog element. This is a jQuery object.
   Use ui.columnKey to get the column key
   Use ui.isAsc to get whether column should be ascending or not. If true it should be ascending

applySortedColumnCss.description: Enables/disables special styling for sorted columns. If false, sorted column cells will not have any special sort-related styling

caseSensitive.description: Enables or disables the case sensitivity of the sorting. Works only for local sorting

columnSettings.description: List of custom column settings that specify custom sorting settings for a specific column (whether sorting is enabled / disabled, default sort direction, first sort direction, etc.)

columnKey.description: Specifies the column key of the sorted column

columnIndex.description: Column index can be used in place of column key. The preferred way of populating a column setting is to always use the column keys as identifiers.

firstSortDirection.description: This will be the first sort direction when the column hasn't been sorted before

valueOptions.name: asc
valueOptions.description: The sort direction will be ascending

valueOptions.name: desc
valueOptions.description: The sort direction will be descending

currentSortDirection.description: The current (or default) sort direction. If this setting is specified, the column will be rendered sorted according to this option.

valueOptions.name: asc
valueOptions.description: The sort direction will be ascending

valueOptions.name: desc
valueOptions.description: The sort direction will be descending

allowSorting.description: Enables / disables sorting on the specified column. By default all columns are sortable

customSortFunction.description: custom sort function accepting three parameters - the data to be sorted, an array of data source field definitions, and the direction to sort with (optional). The function should return the sorted data array

firstSortDirection.description: Specifies which direction to use on the first click / keydown, if the column hasn't been sorted before

modalDialogAnimationDuration.description: Specifies time of milliseconds for animation duration to show/hide modal dialog

modalDialogButtonApplyText.description: Specifies text of button which apply changes in modal dialog

modalDialogButtonCancelText.description: Specifies text of button which cancel changes in modal dialog

modalDialogCaptionButtonAsc.description: Specifies caption for each ascending sorted column in multiple sorting dialog

modalDialogCaptionButtonDesc.description: Specifies caption for each descending sorted column in multiple sorting dialog

modalDialogCaptionButtonUnsort.description: Specifies caption for unsort button in multiple sorting dialog

modalDialogCaptionText.description: Specifies caption text for multiple sorting dialog

modalDialogHeight.description: Specifies height of multiple sorting dialog

modalDialogResetButtonLabel.description: Specifies sortby button label for each unsorted column in multiple sorting dialog

modalDialogSortByButtonText.description: Specifies sortby button text for each unsorted column in multiple sorting dialog

modalDialogSortOnClick.description: Specifies whether sorting to be applied immediately when click sort/unsort columns in multiple sorting dialog. When it is false Apply button shows and sorting is applied when the button is clicked

modalDialogWidth.description: Specifies width of multiple sorting dialog

mode.description: Defines single column sorting or multiple column sorting.

valueOptions.name: multi
valueOptions.description: Defines multiple column sorting. If enabled, previous sorted state for columns won't be cleared

sortedColumnTooltip.description: custom sorted column tooltip in jQuery templating format

sortUrlKey.description: URL param name which specifies how sorting expressions will be encoded in the URL. Uses OData conventions. ex: ?sort(col1)=asc

sortUrlKeyAscValue.description: URL param value for ascending type of sorting. Uses OData conventions. Example: ?sort(col1)=asc

sortUrlKeyDescValue.description: URL param value for descending type of sorting. Uses OData conventions

unsortedColumnTooltip.description: Custom unsorted column tooltip in jQuery templating format
